lexUnit.name: distinctive.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: individually characteristic; distinct from others of its kind.

sentence.text: But , and this is a major qualification , the nature of the mystical powers involved , their shape and distinctive characteristics ( or phenomenology ) are not predictable from the social organization .

In fact , it is clear that the main characteristics of national industrial relations , their dominant and distinctive features , seem to be established at a fairly early stage in the industrial development of a country .
They gave themselves away by their distinctive styles .
In distinctive feature analysis the features themselves thus become important components of the phonology .
The single most distinctive feature of the English sentencing system is the breadth of discretion that is conferred on sentencers at all levels within the system .

( 5 ) Assess your significant competitors for the different types of work you undertake ( or would like to undertake ) , their distinctive features , their market representation and legal specialisation .
Such communities acquired their own distinctive character and many welcomed the Evangelical Revival with enthusiasm .
The distinctive features of a political system can be recognized by comparing that system with another or , better still , with many others .
As with the sliced bread , we were looking for a good , brown appearance , a firm crust , a distinctive aroma and taste with some nuttiness and a firm but springy texture .
The distinctive patterns and processes of government accounting and budgeting are largely a product of the public sector infrastructure .
It is this change ` in unison " that is such a distinctive feature of molecular drive .
Among the pleasures around Oberkirch are the villages , each with its own distinctive style and the bigger town of Offenburg .
The eye-spotted dorsal fin is another distinctive feature .
It is also an extremely distinctive feature in terms of its high level of geographical polarization .
The public rooms each have a distinctive style of their own , from the cosy , rustic ` Challi-Bar " to the elegantly furnished reception area and television room .
They were in effect an inferior kind of man , with no distinctive character of their own .
The distinctive features of the novel as a genre are three-fold : it is written , it is fictional , and its principle device is that of narrative .

Lurpak is made from cream which is ripened for 24 hours before it is churned , a process which imparts its distinctive flavour , and it is subject to rigorous independent testing at every stage of production .
The distinctive feature of the method lies in what it does not do .
Mr Deng 's experience in Taihang , as opposed to Mao 's in Yan'an , shaped at least three distinctive features of his political strategy .
As a result the service has produced administrators with a distinctive approach and outlook .
Penelope , with her brighter red hair and rather flamboyant appearance , was much more distinctive .
Drifting out of an open window , riding over a choppy bassline , comes the distinctive voice of Omar .
The all black bottle was very distinctive .
In the meantime the others had been out on the track and found the footprints of the Friar and the distinctive mark of his staff .
And the most distinctive languages are often the most vulnerable -- those of native peoples .
